name: Hydrangea
description: Hydrangea is a genus of about 70 species of shrubs, trees and climbers in the family Hydrangeaceae, native to southern and eastern Asia.There are many varieties and different types of Hydrangeas. Their big, bushy head and charismatic flowering blooms in intense colors are magnificent for bouquets and arrangements. Hydrangeas are some of the most popular flowers around. These flowers bring timeless beauty and charm which makes them perfect for any setting!
meaning: The genus name comes from the Greek “hydros” (“water”) and “angos” (“jar” or “vessel”). It roughly translates to “water barrel”.
color_description: The flowers come in shades of blue, purple, white, pink and red.
